Fish Sinigang ./img/fishsinigang.jpg Main Course Filipino 15 minutes 35 minutes 5 people 271 kcal
2 lbs fish
40 g Knorr Sinigang sa Sampaloc Mix
2 pieces tomato
1 cup Daikon radish
1 piece onion
3 cups spinach
10 pieces okra
2 pieces eggplant sliced
2 pieces long green pepper
2 quarts water
2 cup cooking oil
1 Â½ tablespoons salt
Fish sauce and ground black pepper to taste
1. Slice the fish as needed. Sprinkle salt all over the fish slices and then rub all over. Let it stay for at least 15 minutes./n 2. Heat oil in a pan. Fry the fish slices until golden brown. Turn it over and perform the same step on the opposite side. Remove fish from the pan. Place in a clean plate. Set aside./n 3. Boil water in a large cooking pot. Add tomato, onion, and radish. Continue boiling for 5 minutes./n 4. Add Knorr Sinigang sa Sampaloc Mix. Stir./n 5. Put the fried fish slices into the pot. Let the liquid boil. Adjust the heat between low to medium. Continue boiling for 7 minutes./n 6. Add eggplant and long green peppers. Cook for 3 minutes./n 7. Add okra. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes./n 8. Season with ground black pepper and fish sauce./n 9. Put the fresh spinach into the pot. Cook for 1 to 2 minutes./n 10. Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve warm. Share and enjoy!/n
